channel.title: Wigner on Archibald
channel.description: Recent content in Wigner on Archibald

item.title: He Retracted the Answer. Nobody Retracted the Question.
item.description:
One of the architects of quantum mechanics wrote a paper in 1961 arguing that consciousness plays a fundamental role in wavefunction collapse. Not a graduate student. Not a New Age physicist who got his PhD and then went to Sedona. Not someone writing a book whose title contains both “quantum” and “healing.”

Eugene Wigner. Nobel Prize in Physics, 1963 â€” “for his contributions to the theory of the atomic nucleus and the elementary particles, particularly through the discovery and application of fundamental symmetry principles.” The man who gave us the Wigner-Eckart theorem and the Wigner D-matrices. One of the people who built the mathematical foundations of quantum mechanics that every physics student has to learn before they’re allowed to do anything else.
